column1: description;http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/;The ETCBC database of the Hebrew Bible (formerly known as WIVU database)
column2: contains the scholarly text of the Hebrew Bible with linguistic markup.

column1: A previous version can be found in EASY (see the link below).
The present dataset is an improvement in many ways:
(A) it contains a new version of the data
column2: called ETCBC4.

column1: The content has been heavily updated
column2: with new linguistic annotations and a better organisation of them
column3: and lots of additions and corrections as well.

column1: (B) the data format is now Linguistic Annotation Framework (see below). This contrasts with the previous version
column2: which has been archived as a database dump in a specialised format: Emdros (see the link below).
LAF-Fabric is added to process the ETCBC4 version directly from its LAF representation. The picture on this page shows a few samples what can be done with it.
including a description of all the computing steps involved in getting the data in LAF format.
